title: Tips for Buying the Best Macbook Pro
summary: The 13-inch Macbook Pro is the most popular version, and the one we would recommend to most people. It's not the most powerful, but it’s powerful enough for most people, and it's great for everyday use. The 15-inch version is the best option for people who need more power. The Touch Bar is only available with a Touch Bar, so if you don’t need it, you need to go with the 15-in version. The 17-inch model is the biggest, with a battery life of up to 10 hours, and is great for watching movies and TV shows. It comes in both the 13-in and the Touch Bar version.

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:o,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:o,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`The MacBook Pro is one of the most popular laptops on the market, and they\u2019re great machines. But with so many different versions to choose from, it can be difficult to know which one is right for you. Do you need a Touch Bar or not? What screen size do you need? How much storage space do you need? These are all questions you need to ask yourself before buying a Macbook Pro.
If you\u2019re thinking about buying a Macbook Pro, here are some helpful tips to make sure you get the best model for your needs. The Macbook Pro comes in 13-inch, 15-inch and 17-inch screens, so that\u2019s the first thing to consider when buying one. You also want to decide whether you need an integrated GPU (not all models have them) and how much storage space you want.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

content.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:o,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:o,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("h2",null,"13-inch Screen Macbook Pro"),mdx("p",null,"The 13-inch Macbook Pro is the most popular version, and the one we would recommend to most people. It\u2019s compact and lightweight, making it easy to carry around. It\u2019s also the cheapest option, making it a great choice if you\u2019re on a budget. It\u2019s a great laptop for running multiple programs at once, with 8 GB RAM and a 256 GB SSD, and if you\u2019re a student or someone who travels a lot, this is the one we would recommend. It\u2019s not the most powerful laptop, but it\u2019s powerful enough for most people, and it\u2019s great for everyday use. It\u2019s the most reliable version too, so it\u2019s definitely worth considering if you\u2019re after a Macbook Pro."),mdx("h2",null,"15-inch Screen Macbook Pro"),mdx("p",null,"The 15-inch Macbook Pro is the best version for people who need more power. It\u2019s a more heavyweight option, but it\u2019s great if you run heavy programs like photo editing, video editing or if you\u2019re a designer. The bigger screen size is also great for watching movies and TV shows, so if you\u2019re an avid TV binger, this one is a good option. One thing to note is that the 15-inch Macbook Pro is only available with a Touch Bar, so if you don\u2019t need a Touch Bar, it\u2019s not worth the extra money. It\u2019s also a more expensive option, so it\u2019s worth considering if you really need a more powerful laptop. It\u2019s a great option for people who run programming, design or video editing software regularly."),mdx("h2",null,"17-inch Screen Macbook Pro"),mdx("p",null,"The 17-inch Macbook Pro is the best option for people who need a laptop for work. It\u2019s the most powerful option out of the Macbook Pros, as it has two fans to keep the laptop cool, and a giant battery life of up to 10 hours. It\u2019s also the biggest, so if portability is important to you, it\u2019s definitely worth avoiding. That said, it\u2019s the best option for people who need their laptop to run multiple programs at once, making it the best option for people who work regularly on the go."),mdx("p",null,"It\u2019s worth noting that it comes with an IGP instead of a discrete GPU, so it\u2019s not the best option for editing videos or running graphic design software. If you need a laptop for work, this is the best option, but it\u2019s worth considering if you want something more portable."),mdx("h2",null,"Touch Bar Macbook Pro"),mdx("p",null,"The Touch Bar Macbook Pro comes in both the 15-inch and the 13-inch version and costs a little more than the non-Touch Bar version. It\u2019s a good choice if you want the Touch Bar, but don\u2019t want a more heavyweight option. It\u2019s also worth noting that the 13-inch model is lighter and more compact than the 15-inch model, so if portability is important to you, it\u2019s worth considering. That said, it\u2019s worth being aware that the IGP makes it more difficult for programs to run at once, so it\u2019s not the best option for people who run heavy programs regularly. It\u2019s a good option for people who want to use the Macbook Pro for everyday tasks, and don\u2019t need a laptop for work. It\u2019s definitely worth considering if you want a cheap Macbook Pro, but it\u2019s worth being aware that you won\u2019t get the best performance out of the three."),mdx("h2",null,"Storage Space and RAM in the Macbook Pro"),mdx("p",null,"The Macbook Pro comes with either 128 GB, 256 GB, 512 GB or 1 TB of storage space, so if storage space is important to you, it\u2019s worth considering how much you need. 128 GB is the minimum amount of storage space needed, but if you\u2019re someone who likes to store a lot on their laptop, or if you need to regularly store files, it\u2019s worth going for the 256 GB or 512 GB option."),mdx("p",null,"The Macbook Pro also comes with 8 GB or 16 GB of RAM, so if you need more than 8 GB, it\u2019s worth considering the 16 GB option. It\u2019s important to note that models with 16 GB of RAM only come with the 1 TB of storage space, so it\u2019s worth keeping that in mind if you need more storage space."),mdx("h2",null,"Conclusion"),mdx("p",null,"The MacBook Pro is an excellent choice for people who want a laptop for a variety of different tasks. It\u2019s a powerful machine, and there is a version for everyone, no matter what you need it for. It\u2019s important to consider what screen size you want, what version you want, and how much storage space you need to make sure you get the best model for your needs."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Rise of the Big Four Tech Companies: Google, Amazon, Facebook and Apple

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`New digital technologies are restructuring global markets and weakening old business models.  Artificial intelligence, computer vision and voice recognition are among the new technologies that will continue to change industries as we know them. While many companies struggle to adapt to this fast-changing environment, a small handful of tech giants have thrived in this new digital landscape, amassing huge market shares in their respective fields. These companies are known collectively as the \u2018big four\u2019 or \u2018big four tech companies\u2019: Google, Amazon, Facebook and Apple.
These firms represent a very recent type of business model. Most obviously, they are all technology companies (they sell software and hardware). They are also all data companies \u2013 their products all rely on collecting, storing and processing huge quantities of user data. Finally, they are what can be called \u2018closed loop\u2019 businesses: They tend to operate closed systems that lock users into using their services exclusively; for example by locking users into using their search engine rather than other search engines or by locking users into using their social network rather than others such`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How Big Tech Is Changing the Way We Live and Work

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Millennials are now the largest generation of workers in the U.S., and as they advance their careers, they\u2019ll continue to reshape how and where we work. The digital age has made it possible for people to work from virtually anywhere at any time. As a result, more people are leaving the office behind and working remotely or taking up independent contracting gigs, which is why we\u2019re seeing so many young professionals ditch cubicles for coffee shops and other remote-friendly offices.
Working from home, going independent, or collaborating with coworkers online means millennials have given rise to what some have called \u201Cthe gig economy.\u201D It\u2019s also prompted a shift in the types of companies people choose to work for and what skills they need to get hired in those roles \u2014 regardless of where they do that work. If you\u2019re looking to join this world of work in 2020, here\u2019s everything you need to know:`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: Your Guide to the Best Smartphone for Your Budget

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Smartphones have become an essential part of our lives. We use them for a lot more than just making calls or sending texts. Smartphones are useful for staying in touch with friends and family, for browsing the internet, for checking your email, and for keeping track of appointments.
They\u2019re also useful for streaming music, taking photos and videos, storing documents you need to access on the go, and keeping track of your fitness goals by monitoring your steps taken and calories burned.
With so many different smartphone manufacturers and models out there it can be hard to know which one is right for you. Do you want a high end phone with all the bells and whistles? Or would a cheaper option suit your needs just fine?
If you\u2019re looking to buy a new smartphone in 2019 but aren\u2019t sure where to start, read on to discover our guide to the best smartphones in 2019, broken down by budget.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: Getting the Most Out of Your Smartphone: Tips and Tricks

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:o,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:o,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Smartphones can do a lot more than most people think. Those tiny devices packed with a dizzying array of features are also virtual Swiss Army knives, able to adapt to almost any situation. That\u2019s because your phone is actually an \u201Cintelligent\u201D device, as opposed to just being another way to check email or browse social media. Smartphones have the ability to learn and grow based on your usage habits, which means that if you know what you\u2019re doing, your phone can do even more than you think.
In this post, we will share some tips and tricks that will help you get the most out of your smartphone. Keeping reading for useful advice on how to use your smartphone more efficiently, how to store photos properly so they take up less space on your device, how to download apps that won\u2019t chew up memory unnecessarily and many other helpful tricks you didn\u2019t know about!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Best Smartphones of 2022: What to Buy and Why

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Smartphone technology is constantly evolving, and the best smartphones of 2022 will be much different than even the most cutting-edge devices of today. These innovations won\u2019t just be incremental improvements on the features we take for granted right now; they will be game-changing changes that make a big difference in how we use our phones.
Today\u2019s best smartphones are fast and powerful, with high resolution cameras, long battery life, crisp displays and more. But by 2022, these devices may seem almost Stone Age in comparison to what comes after them. Read on to learn about some of the biggest upcoming changes in smartphone tech, along with details about which models you should consider buying if you\u2019re shopping for a new phone in 2022.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How AI Is Changing the Way We Live and Work

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...n}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...n,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"New artificial intelligence (AI) technologies are automating tasks once reserved for humans, elevating the importance of thinking and creative problem-solving to stay relevant in the workplace. AI is also enabling businesses to reduce costs, drive revenue and increase efficiency. Emerging AI solutions are making it easier than ever before to use machine learning. Whether you\u2019re new to AI or want a refresher on the latest AI trends, this guide covers everything you need to know about how artificial intelligence is changing the way we live and work."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: Google's Monopoly: How the Tech Giant Controls Our Lives
Making Apple Inc Great Again: How to Make the Most of Your Apple Device

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"Today, just about everyone has a smartphone. If you\u2019re reading this blog right now, chances are you do too. But how much do you know about the phone you carry around with you everywhere? There\u2019s a lot of information out there on Apple Inc and its products, but not all of it is useful. Let\u2019s be honest: When was the last time you used an Apple device to learn about the company itself? Probably never. The tricky thing about having so many devices from one company is that it can be hard to find information that applies directly to each device as an individual unit. That\u2019s why we\u2019ve compiled this guide - to show you how to make the most of your Apple device by accessing its hidden features, customizing it to fit your needs, and keeping track of everything important in one place."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
